sen.e: Japan
Japan
Japan

sen.j: 観世 栄夫（かんぜ ひでお、1927年8月3日 - 2007年6月8日）は、シテ方観世流能楽師、俳優。
sen.e: Hideo KANZE (August 3, 1927-June 8, 2007) was a Noh actor, shite-kata (main roles) of Kanze school and actor.
Hideo KANZE (August 3, 1927 - June 8, 2007) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (principal roles) of Kanze-ryu school and an actor.
Hideo KANZE (August 3, 1927 - June 8, 2007) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (principal roles) of Kanze-ryu school and an actor.

sen.j: 一時喜多流に転流したが、その後観世流に復帰していた。
sen.e: He temporarily transferred to the Kita school but later came back to the Kanze school.
sen.cmt: この文章中における「転流」の意味がわかりませんでしたが、「移る」の意味と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: He temporarily transferred to the Kita-ryu school but later came back to the Kanze-ryu school.
He temporarily transferred to the Kita-ryu school but later came back to the Kanze-ryu school.

sen.j: 能楽師・7代観世雅雪の次男として観世銕之丞家に生れる。
sen.e: He was born to the Tetsunojo KANZE family as the second son of the Noh actor Gasetsu KANZE, the 7th.
He was born to the Tetsunojo KANZE family as the second son of the Nohgakushi Gasetsu KANZE, the seventh.
He was born to the Tetsunojo KANZE family as the second son of the Nohgakushi Gasetsu KANZE, the seventh.

sen.j: 父及び観世華雪、喜多六平太、喜多実、後藤得三に師事。
sen.e: He studied under his father, Kasetsu KANZE, Roppeita KITA, Minoru KITA and Tokuzo GOTO.
He studied under his father, Kasetsu KANZE, Roppeita KITA, Minoru KITA and Tokuzo GOTO.
He studied under his father, Kasetsu KANZE, Roppeita KITA, Minoru KITA and Tokuzo GOTO.
He left the world of Noh in 1958.
He left the world of Noh in 1958.
He left the world of Noh in 1958.

sen.j: 現代演劇、映画、舞踊などに活躍するが1979年、能楽に復帰。
sen.e: He appeared in modern plays, movies and dance performances, and in 1979, he went back to nogaku (the art of Noh).
He appeared in modern plays, movies and dance performances, and in 1979, he went back to Nohgaku (the art of Noh).
He appeared in modern plays, movies and dance performances, and in 1979, he went back to Nohgaku (the art of Noh).

sen.j: また京都造形芸術大学教授も務める。
sen.e: He also works as a professor in the Kyoto University of Art and Design.
He also worked as a professor in the Kyoto University of Art and Design.
He also worked as a professor in the Kyoto University of Art and Design.

sen.j: 妻は谷崎潤一郎の養女（潤一郎の妻・松子の連れ子）・恵美子。
sen.e: His wife was Emiko, the adopted daughter of Junichiro TANIZAKI (Junichiro's wife Matsuko's daughter).
His wife was Emiko, the adopted daughter of Junichiro TANIZAKI (a child by a former marriage of his wife, Matsuko).
His wife was Emiko, the adopted daughter of Junichiro TANIZAKI (a child by a former marriage of his wife, Matsuko).

sen.j: ドキュメンタリードラマ『終戦の日の荷風と潤一郎』（1984年、朝日放送）で谷崎役を演じたこともある。
sen.e: He once played the role of Tanizaki in a documentary type drama "Shusen no hi no Kafu to Junichiro" (Kafu and Junichiro on the end of the war) (1984, Asahi Broadcasting Corporation).
He once played the role of Tanizaki in a documentary type drama "Shusen no hi no Kafu to Junichiro" (Kafu and Junichiro on the end of the war) (1984, Asahi Broadcasting Corporation).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He once played the role of Tanizaki in a documentary type drama "Shusen no hi no Kafu to Junichiro" (Kafu and Junichiro on the end of the war) (1984, Asahi Broadcasting Corporation).

sen.j: 1997年芸術選奨文部大臣賞、1998年モービル音楽賞、2001年勲四等瑞宝章。
sen.e: Received Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts in 1997, Mobile music award in 1998 and The Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Rosette in 2001.
Received Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts in 1997, Mobile music award in 1998 and The Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon in 2001.
Received Minister of Education Award for Fine Arts in 1997, Mobile music award in 1998 and The Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon in 2001.

sen.j: 2007年6月8日午前8時35分、大腸癌のため東京都墨田区の墨田中央病院で死去。
sen.e: He died from colorectal cancer at 8:35 AM on June 8, 2007 at the Sumida Chuo Hospital in Sumida Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.
He died from colorectal cancer at 8:35 AM on June 8, 2007 at the Sumida Chuo Hospital in Sumida Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.
He died from colorectal cancer at 8:35 AM on June 8, 2007 at the Sumida Chuo Hospital in Sumida Ward, Tokyo Prefecture.
